text: Eleanor Jessie Coppola ( Neil; May 4, 1936 â€“ April 12, 2024) was an American movie director, screenwriter, and artist. She was married to director Francis Ford Coppola from 1963 until her death. She was best-known for her 1991 documentary movie Hearts of Darkness: A Filmmaker's Apocalypse. She won an Emmy Award in 1992. Coppola died in Rutherford, California from lymphoma on April 12, 2024, at the age of 87. ==References== ==Other websites== * Interview with Ms. Coppola * * Rubicon Estate Winery * Coppola's Windows (1973) on SFMOMA Open Space Category:1936 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Movie directors from Los Angeles Category:Screenwriters from Los Angeles Category:Artists from Los Angeles Category:American television directors Category:Emmy Award winning directors Category:Deaths from lymphoma Category:Cancer deaths in California
title: Eleanor Coppola
